title: T-90
description: The T-90 is a Russian third-generation main battle tank developed from the T-72 platform by Uralvagonzavod. It features a combination of modern fire control systems, explosive reactive armor, and advanced night-fighting capabilities.
history: Developed in the late 1980s and officially entering service in 1992, the T-90 became Russiaâ€™s mainstay tank following the collapse of the Soviet Union. It has since evolved through multiple modernizations such as the T-90A, T-90AM, and T-90M 'Proryv-3', maintaining relevance through export success and continued upgrades.

variants.name: T-90 (Object 188)
variants.description: Original production version introduced in 1992, based on the T-72B chassis with improved armor and fire control.

variants.name: T-90K
variants.description: Command variant of the T-90 equipped with enhanced communications and navigation systems.

variants.name: T-90S
variants.description: Export version of the T-90, widely sold abroad, notably to India as the 'Bhishma'.

variants.name: T-90SK
variants.description: Command version of the T-90S for export customers, fitted with upgraded communication systems.

variants.name: T-90A (Object 188A)
variants.description: First major Russian modernization featuring a new welded turret and improved thermal sights.

variants.name: T-90AK (Object 188A1K)
variants.description: Command version of the T-90A with advanced communication and command systems.

variants.name: T-90A (Object 188A2)
variants.description: Upgraded T-90A with enhanced armor and improved sensor suite.

variants.name: T-90AK (Object 188A2K)
variants.description: Command version of the upgraded T-90A (Object 188A2).

variants.name: T-90SA
variants.description: Desert-adapted export version of the T-90S, developed for Middle Eastern customers such as Algeria.

variants.name: T-90SKA
variants.description: Command variant of the desert-configured T-90SA.

variants.name: T-90AM 'Proryv-2'
variants.description: Prototype modernization featuring the new 'Kalina' fire control system, advanced armor, and improved crew ergonomics.

variants.name: T-90AMK
variants.description: Command version of the T-90AM prototype.

variants.name: T-90SM
variants.description: Export variant of the T-90AM with modern electronics, improved protection, and optional climate adaptations.

variants.name: T-90SMK
variants.description: Command variant of the T-90SM export model.

variants.name: T-90MS 'Tagil'
variants.description: Export model of the T-90M featuring the 'Kalina' system and modular ERA armor; unveiled as 'Tagil' in 2011.

variants.name: T-90M 'Proryv-3'
variants.description: Latest Russian service version with a new welded turret, 2A46M-5 gun, improved 'Kalina' system, and enhanced situational awareness.

variants.name: T-90MS
variants.description: Refined export derivative of the T-90M with similar systems adapted for foreign customers.

variants.name: T-90M2 'Ryvok-1'
variants.description: Experimental modernization featuring further upgrades to armor, sensors, and mobility over the T-90M.
